Reviews.Title: “No problemswith this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: UncleTom46 Posted by a CoopTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for its location as we were going to see Mamma Mia at the Prince of Wales theatre next door. I had seen some adverse reviews but also some excellent ones. I took a chance and booked it and was not dissappointed, in fact we were pleasantly surprised. Check in was easy and the receptionist was very polite and helpful. Although this hotel does not serve dinner we were offered dinner at another Thistle hotel, the nearby Royal Trafalgar in Whitcomb Street. In the event we settled for an excellent dinner at TGI Fridays which was just the other side of the theatre. Our package didn't include breakfast but we paid a very reasonable £10 per head when we checked in for what turned out to be an excellent "Full English" the following morning served by very pleasant and attentive staff. We were allocated room 708 which, along with the rest of that floor, had very recently been refurbished. The room was spacious, had been very tastefully decorated,and had good quality furnishings and fittings, wide screen TV, leather swivel chair at desk etc. There was a freshly decorated smell and I wouldn't be surprised if we were the first occupants since the refurbishment. The surrounding area, like much of the tourist parts of London, is undergoing extensive modernisation ready for the Olympics but we didn't experience any undue noise from this nor from the St Patrick's day crowds. The whole hotel is undergoing a complete modernised and so long as you get one of these rooms I would wholeheartedly recommend this hotel for it's location, room quality and helpfulness of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “What a gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chel89
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend treated me to this hotel for my birthday on 17th march 2012. We done the £50 upgrade for the junior suite! It was absolutely beautiful; really modern and iwola on the front desk was a total pleasure to deal with! We got a free bottle of wine for my birthday on the house & was wished a happy birthday by all staff. It was very personal & wonderful. The room service was very quick & the breakfast you shouldn't miss! I WILL DEFINATELY be back. Recommend to all. X

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Leicester Square but in need of the renovation underway”
Reviews.Author: travellertopoland2
Reviews.Content: My companion and I stayed again, booking through http://www.between9and5.com/en/ However on arrival I found the hotel could find no trace of our booking. But, on presentation of a printout, the young Polish receptionist quickly honoured it. We paid £95 for the day. The hotel is is a side street between Trafalgar Square and Leicester Square, so ideal tourist location. But the hotel is in need of a makeover and, during our brief stay, we heard drills and saw new doors being carried up the stairs. We had room 107. Quite small and old fashioned - with a portable electric radiator and a wall mounted air conditioner. However there was an iron and board. The bed had a softish mattress but was surprisingly comfortable to rest on. The bathroom had a cold floor but was spacious. The shower worked well. Though check in had been slow, checkout was slick. We had no meals in the hotel. There are plenty of chain places round the area in which to eat. Leicester square itself is a huge building site at the moment. So do not expect to see any sights there!

Reviews.Title: “Get the upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Harriet1910
Reviews.Content: We booked our hotel for Sat 3rd March as our children had paid for a theatre hotel break for 2nd March and we wanted to extend our stay. This hotel came up the cheapest at just over £100 for the one night. When we arrived we were asked would we like to upgrade for an extra £20 and i am so pleased we did as the room had been beautifully refurbished and was lovely - clean, comfortable and modern and directly on the corner so we had a good view up Leicester Square. If we were coming to London again we would book here again - and a prime location too. I only missed the 5th circle rating as we did not dine at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful”
Reviews.Author: Graham170364
Reviews.Content: On the 11th Feb I walked into the Thistle Piccadilly (Not knowing this at the time) and in giving the receptionist my printed off email asked if I was in the right place. I wax looking for The Royal Trafalgar ( Thistle). I was told to take a seat and that my room would be ready soon. On entering my room I was amazed to find damp, broken tiles as well as rust all over the shower rail( see pictures). An hour later I came across the hotel that I had originally booked and paid for months before, The Royal Trafalgar. It seems that the Thistle chain have TWO hotels in the same street!. Why wasn,t I told that in fact I was in the wrong hotel, and that I needed to go only a few meters down the road where I would find the hotel that I had booked!!!!!. I went into the Royal Trafalgar and tried to check in, no chance. I was told it was to late as I had already checked in to the Piccadilly. After a long and heated conversation I was given my original room, but only for one night, Sunday.My romantic valentines weeken was spent part in a rundown, tired, damp mouldy room, and at the reception for nearly two hours waiting for my room. Not good enough

Reviews.Title: “Mouldy Bathroom Ceiling”
Reviews.Author: ScottishExposure
Reviews.Content: Sorry Thistle but I was very disappointed. The ONLY good thing was the location. This hotel needs serious refurbishment , I don't mind old fashioned but mouldy ceilings for example is complacency at its best. We had 4 rooms between us and we all had issues with the cleanliness of the rooms. Not good... and definitely not four star.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - but could do better!”
Reviews.Author: Jennebel
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick enough, and we were given room 309, which was a nice spacious room on the corner of the hotel, overlooking Leicester Square. Only 1 of the 2 lifts was working all weekend though! The bed was enormous and bedding clean. So far so good! As many people have stated, the rooms are long overdue a rehaul, particularly the ancient bathrooms! No main light in the room, and insufficient light from the 4 lamps - common trait with energy saving bulbs! Upon walking into the bathroom, I immediately slid across the floor due to an enormous puddle of water on the tiles. Upon closer inspection, the water was a longstanding problem with the radiator in the bathroom. It had been switched off (obviously to try and rectify the issue) and there was a dark brown stain on the tiles where it has clearly dripped for some time. I called for someone to fix it/move us. We were going out about half an hour later, and still hadn't had anyone to look at it, so mentioned it again at reception, where we were assured it would be fixed 'shortly'. We returned from the theatre about 11pm to an even larger pool in the bathroom. Again, I contacted reception and received a call back from the night manager. He advised that there was no record of my previous requests, and that he couldn't move us due to the hotel being fully booked. He did send someone up with more towels, and provided a bottle of complimentary wine, and assured me that it would be resolved in the morning. Great. Had a brilliant nights sleep - bed MEGA comfy! About to leave the room at 11am, when we received a call saying they couldnt relocate us, as the hotel was still fully booked, so they sent a man with a spanner to fix it instead. When we got back, the dripping had stopped but the radiator still didn't work, which led to the bathroom still being very cold. Anyway - another fab night's sleep, but sadly, when we went down to breakfast at 9.45 (breakfast served til 11), half of the food wasn't available, there were 6 empty tables, but we still had to stand and wait whilst they prepared one for us. The food was being replenished as we were finishing what we had. Shame really, as the previous day, the breakfast was excellent! All in all, it has the potential to be brilliant, and you can see that there are works taking place to make the hotel pretty in time for the olympics, however, these works are years overdue, so the hotel should stop using it as an excuse for the state of the rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but poor quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: unitedlegend
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location but the hotel is in need of redecoration and the quality of service was lacking. We had issues with the lights (no bulbs either of the two lights!) and hairdrier (did not work!). There isnt a large light in the room so even when the bulbs had been fitted it was still lacking light. After asking for a hair drier from reception, we were asked to return it after using it and collect it each morning - not the quality of service expected! The room was very dated and scruffy. The breakfast was good, and the hotel will probably be very good once redecorated - until then there are better alternatives within the Piccadilly Circus area.

Reviews.Title: “Needs lots of work”
Reviews.Author: spectator
Reviews.Content: The Thistle Piccadilly is a Victorian Hotel in Leicester Square. The "bones" of the hotel are fine: large rooms, good HVAC system, lots of hot water; however, it is very tired and need to be refurbished. Management has started this process. We were given a tour of the Thistle Trafalgar which has been refurbished and told this hotel would look similar. The Trafalgar looked up to date but the average room is smaller than those in the Piccadilly. The location is superb if you are going to West End Theater. Leicester Sq is a mess as well and it too is getting refurbished - I suspect all will be done: hotel and square before the Olympics. To cut to the quick, I would not stay at this hotel until after it has been redone and I think at that point it will be excellent. Note as in almost all hotels that I have stayed at in London, internet / wifi is not free. A 5 day wifi pass was around $45 USD and they really get you for a 24 hr pass. The staff was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Catfish-angel
Reviews.Content: We were moved to this hotel from the Piccadilly Thistle due to a leak before we arrived and enjoyed the Piccadilly Thistle very much. The room and storage were both good, the place was clean and the staff couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful. I would have liked a view which didn't include the air vents but we could see Nelson on his column from our window plus my husband loves London roofscapes! Great location, too! Would stay here again without a second's though.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: erichowell09
Reviews.Content: It is really hard to find a better placed hotel, perfectly situated between Piccadilly Circus and Leicester Sq, and for this reason it is very good. The truth is though that although this hotel ticks the boxes for 4 star standards, guests should note that it is dated and is in need of a real deep clean. The room itself was a little small, and again the bathroom could be brought into the modern era but in reality your not in London to spend time in your room. The staff were very good, and for the price i paid I would certainly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “stayed once before but this time was awful!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: louise b
Reviews.Content: i have stayed here once before but in the mini suite this time i stayed in a standard double which was awful.wasnt cheep by any means so was shocked to find that the room was pitch black and we signed in at 3 in day time.there was a wall about 2 foot from the window which blocked out all the light, to make matters worse there was no light in room apart from the two bedside lamps.Outside the window there was a huge air conditioning fan which made such a bad banging sound i had very little sleep when i can usualy sleep through anything.there was a socket on the wall which you could fit your hand in top as was fitted so bad.the carpet was ripped and the door bar was broke so everytime you tried to go in bathroom you triped over it.the bathroom was old and not the cleanest ever.the toliet and shower curtain was stained.terrible stay!! when i stayed before we had a nice view,dated room but nice this time it was the worse hotel room ive stayed in.but on plus side location is great

Reviews.Title: “Rip off hotel”
Reviews.Author: justhadtosay
Reviews.Content: This hotel sums up all that is bad about 'rip off Britain' - poor quality, high prices, when will they ever learn?? It is embarrassing to think that foreign tourists stay in places like this and assume that it is what passes for decent accommodation in the UK. The location in Leicester Sq is not the most pleasant, but it is very central and near everything - no doubt how they stay in business. The room we had enjoyed a fairly awful view but you could see - from the small window - the London Eye so whoever had the room on Dec 31 was quite lucky!! The room was tiny, in dire need of redecoration. The bathroom was awful although the shower was, if old, effective and the towels were very good. There was a lack of storage generally as the room was so small. The general feel of the corridors/lift etc is of a seedy cheap hotel. The staff were very pleasant and efficient. I did find it odd though at midnight that the front door was open, the reception in darkness, with no visible security - possibly one security guard - in an area that would in my view require very tight security at night. The bed was however comfortable and clean. I wouldn't stay here again but then if you are on a very small budget and get a very cheap deal, it is worth considering. How on earth it got 4 stars, I will never know. We looked forward to a night in London and were very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific service & great location”
Reviews.Author: Vic1245
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with friendly efficient service. Good value room and breakfast. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally placed for London City & Theatre Breaks”
Reviews.Author: thecassons
Reviews.Content: Shopping, good restaurants and lots of theatres close by - that was what my wife requested from our hotel, where we stayed the night of her 40th Birthday. We were not disappointed! The Thistle is right on top of Leicester Sq with everything else minutes away on foot. We were greeted within seconds of entering the hotel and booking in took no more than 5 minutes. We were given a hotel on the 7th floor and on entering I felt immediately at home. The decor could perhaps do with updating and one or two of the fittings were broken (bedside lamp, hook on bathroom door) but this just added to the charm of the hotel, which is what we look for. If we wanted bland, no character rooms we could have paid less and gone to Travelodge - but the extra cost was well worth it, particularly due to the very friendly staff and excellent restaurant where we had breakfast the following morning. We will definitely be staying here again when we have the opportunity. A lovely, charmiing hote.

Reviews.Title: “Theatre break”
Reviews.Author: Princess766
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as it was the only one available near the Piccadilly Theatre, for a show we were attending. Also we didn't want travel on the underground late at night, in the cold. The hotel was within easy walking distance to the theatre and there were two tube stations nearby. As it's in the centre of Piccadilly, there's plenty to see and do. We didn't buy any drinks at the hotel as there are plenty of bars and plenty of restaurants nearby. The hotel seems nice from the outside and rather posh, until you walk in your opinions begin to change. Checking in took long although the staff were helpful and friendly. As you walk up the corridors you begin to realise by the sight of the doors of the other rooms how dated the hotel is. There's bits of paper peeling off, and the skirting boards could do with a lick of paint. Our room was on the 4th floor, it was spacious with an enormous bed, the bathroom was rather dated, with baby pink tiles. There was a bath with a shower curtain around it, and there was a shower over the bath. The shower head had limescale on it and the basin taps were very dated and the plug holes were dull and rusty coloured. In the room there was no ceiling lights, however there were two bedside lamps, a floor standing lamp, and another lamp on the table, still made the room rather dim. It felt like a room from the 70's. Don't get me wrong it was clean. The only modern thing was the flat screen TV and the electric kettle. It felt cold in the room, the windows weren't double glazed, however there was a radiator in the room. Fortunately our room was on the 4th floor and situated at the back of the hotel, so we didn't notice the noise. However there was no view out the windows as all we could see were roof tops, just as well that it went dark at 4pm. The breakfast was nothing special just the usual standard buffet type, not a great deal of selection. The dining room was rather small and neatly laid out. For the price we paid it wasn't worth it, you're paying for the location. I'm a regular traveller to London and have stayed in better hotels, for a night's stay it was ok, and I wouldn't consider booking this again. If you're planning to stay longer I wouldn't recommend this hotel. The hotel could do with a good refurbishment, and needs to be updated with modern features.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Office Party”
Reviews.Author: cobbnuts
Reviews.Content: My office team booked our Christmas party at the hotel and I arrived 10 minutes early yesterday afternoon and enquired at reception where the party was being held? The receptionist told me that it was in their Trafalgar Square property 200 yards down the road. So off I trotted and on reaching it was informed no, it is in the Thistle Piccadilly, so off I trotted back. This time I avoided reception and asked one of the waiters in the bar where the office party was being held and he kindly directed me to the basement restaurant. The party got underway and the meal was served. The starter was fine and the main dish was served without any vegetables. We all tucked in and would you believe the vegetables were brought to the table about 20 minutes later, overcooked, when all had finished their main dish. The Xmas pudding served up for sweet was as hard as a rock, also overcooked. Would I recommend it, No I certainly would not. Save your money.

Reviews.Title: “Redeemed by the helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Concentric
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here before and, to be honest usually avoid it because of the noisy neighbourhood. However, I had no choice this time as it was the only room I could get at a reaonable price at short notice. I agree with comments about being 'tired' (the hotel as well as me :-) ), but everything was clean. My room was noisy (on the inside) but this was resolved very quickly and courteously. That the hotel is so central is fantastic but only if you can sleep through a lot of noise (or can risk ear plugs as you don't mind missing the alarm clock). The roads outside are noisy all night (calmed down around 6am) and this was midweek (apparently "it's worse on Friday and Saturday"). It would be so much better with sound-proofing.

Reviews.Title: “Location is not everything”
Reviews.Author: thatleon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pretty central but the attention to detail leaves much to be desired. There were lots of small things wrong: - the pressure from the faucets were either non-existent or fire-hose like. - The towels smelt like they had been rinsed in acid. Really smelly. - My room (and those of my colleagues) were absolutely freezing. The windows seemed to be single-glazed ... - The breakfast was expensive and unpleasant. Luckily there are many good options in the area. - No gym. The only exercise option was in a gym five minutes away, at 10 quid an hour. It's central, but bear all the above in mind before choosing the Thistle.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but dated”
Reviews.Author: happytrip0949
Reviews.Content: i recently visited this hotel for a weekend,have stayed before in standard room and this time upgraded to deluxe room but was hard to see any difference- decor shabby in places. on the upside hotel central for west end theatres and good restuarants nearby. location good for travelling by tube as 2 tube stations nearby. staff friendly and helpful. breakfasts well worth having,choices excellent. would stay again

Reviews.Title: “The party goes on and on and on......”
Reviews.Author: sheffieldmac
Reviews.Content: have to agree with all other comments about tired, run down etc however the main issue for guests must be the noise from the street. I haven,t been that close to a party for 30 years! it went on until 5am. I know the hotel are not responsible but they should be more transparent about this so guests can be prepared eg bring ear plugs. It really was horrendous and we got no sleep. One night is manageable but not any more. Staff were understanding but told us this was a happening location. This should be reflected then on the website. I would rather be a bus ride away from the action than pay for a hotel bed but no sleep! very disapppinting.

Reviews.Title: “Thistle Piccadilly, Great Location for London”
Reviews.Author: shaunysheep69
Reviews.Content: I booked three rooms at htis hotel for a get together with friends for a weekend in September. Booked it because it is a wonderful base for London. It is so well located, close to all key sights. The hotel itself was good. We had no problems at all. We were on the 2nd floor, room was good, clean, big and bathroom was spotless. The furniutre is a bit outdated but that wouldnt bothered me to be honest. Staff were all very friendly and they have a little bar which is well stocked. Overall, would really recommend this place for visiting london.

Reviews.Title: “Prime spot but very 'tired'...”
Reviews.Author: Martine97
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a superb spot - indisputably. You would find yourself in the very centre of London, literally minutes from Covent Garden, theatre land and many many attractions and with a choice of tubes nearby to get you anywhere. I believe this is what you are paying for. The staff were courteous and helpful at all times. The rooms are very 'tired' looking at best, shabby at worst (we have stayed a number of times because of the location but even after so-called re-furbishments the hotel fails to improve). We won't be staying again, it's too much money even for the excellent location, it needs a big overhaul.

Reviews.Title: “THIS HOTEL IS A JOKE !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mikey1902
Reviews.Content: stayed here on sunday night, was excited to get away for a short break after a hard week at work, check in at the hotel was fine and first impressions where good, Than i made my way to the room and then i got a big shock !!!! the carpets where patched and grotty the walls where stained the paint work was chipped the shower and bath was so dated and dirty the sink was cracked, i have stayed at better travelodge hotels tnhan this this is not work staying at it is hell stay some where else you have been warned !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Shabby”
Reviews.Author: LardB0y
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on a business trip. Location is absolutely superb if you want to be at the centre of things, and my limited interactions with the staff were all entirely satisfactory. (I called down for an iron and ironing board on arrival which were brought up very promptly; though unfortunately the iron was not very effective.) The main problem is that the hotel is so dated, worn and shabby. All the fixtures, fittings and furnishings in my (standard) room were tired and worn and scuffed. The bathroom was particularly disappointing - very dated decor, worn and cracked tiles, and so on. The bathroom light was more or less hanging off the ceiling, with a large gap between the fitting and the ceiling - I doubt this is entirely safe. One of the plug sockets in the room was also broken in a way that did not inspire confidence. I could not get the tv to work. This is Room 413 in case it is relevant. I did not eat breakfast in the hotel so cannot comment on that. But at the end of the day I was very relieved that I was not paying for the room myself. A colleague of mine had a much better - and more expensive - room on the 7th floor. This was larger and better equipped, but still very dated in terms of decor. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really bad experiance”
Reviews.Author: Tamer76
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Thistle Picadilly for 2 nights. Originally my booking was for 5 nights , yet on the second night on my stay, i heard something in the room, when I woke up, I found out it was a mouse ! YES a MOUSE...of course I rushed into the lobby, honestly the staff were very friendly and helpful, and offered me another room, yet I refused tostay in it as to my surprisem there was a similar complain by another guest the night before, so it seemed that mice got a deal in the hotel !! The managment was ncie and kind enough not t charge me for that night and they transferred me to Thistle Royal Trafalger which is just 3 minutes walk away. Then ew hotel was excellent and nice and clean. To be honest, Thistle Picadilly would have been a great experiance as the location is great, very nice and friendly staff and management, nice spacious rooms yet for me hygiene comes first and hence the poor rating I have given to the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Needs a good clean”
Reviews.Author: WalesSteveE
Reviews.Content: Fantasic location, but otherwise lots of problems. To start with the price I booked with Hotels.com was Â£129 INCLUDING all taxes, however the hotel debited my credit card for an extra 20% VAT. Hotels.com were very good and credited me the extra when I rang them. The actual hotel has a nice lobby and friendly staff, but the rooms are in desperate need of refurbishment. The carpet was very dirty, the wallpaper peeling off the walls and the TV didn't work. Luckily we were only in London for 1 night so it didn't really spoil our stay. However if I was Thistle management I would be very embarassed by the state of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vic1245
Reviews.Content: Clean, good value, great location, friendly service

Reviews.Title: “Location is it's only and best feature!”
Reviews.Author: CeriFrazier
Reviews.Content: Stayed the night of the 6th Nov. Great looking building from outside. Decent Reception. Very pleasant staff. Excellent location. Pretty much agree with all that has been said. Very dated, shabby rooms, stained furniture, grotty carpets, old/tired/stained bathroom. Good beds, big tv. Good standard breakfast & choice. Only acceptable because of location and the fact that we didnt spend much time in room and we got the room far cheaper on booking.com, esp after overhearing the receptionist inform a visitor that a room for the night was over Â£200. I wouldnt choose to stay here again though.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby!”
Reviews.Author: MajHolly
Reviews.Content: As a last minute business trip, I got what I thought was a reasonable price in a very central location (Â£108). The positives are the location, comfortable beds and pillows and friendliness of the staff. It stops there. The negatives are the lack of cleanliness in the rooms (un-vacuumed, older-than-they-should-be carpets), moldy and chipped tiling in the bathroom, overly lime-scaled shower head with only a drip, constant noise of dripping above the room - I couldn't locate the source - wallpaper and paint peeling from the walls, window frames and door frames, television channels didn't work (only radio available)...there are other things but I've covered the worst of it. There was so much wrong with this room (414) that, for one night, it really wasn't worth complaining. I would only hope the management take on board this (and the many other) reviews and really up their standard. I don't expect luxury for the price I paid in central London, but I do expect cleanliness and decor that has been attended at least in the last 10 years.

Reviews.Title: “Another dissatisfied customer”
Reviews.Author: Hannah D
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed at the Thistle Piccadilly on Saturday on the 5th of November for one night and can guarantee we will not be going back . We arrived to check in after the suggested arrival time, however on arrival we was told our room would not be ready for another 30 minutes later and to come back then . 30 minutes later we was told our room was still not ready, the receptionist then chased housekeeping and we was left hanging around in reception with no further explanation . Finally at 4pm we was checked into room 413. I have stayed in many hotels and comparing this room to the standard I am used to can honestly say this hotel did not live up to this . The room only had one working plug socket, was dated, shabby , very small and in need of serous modernisation and poor value for money I am a regular customer of the "Thistle " chain especially at the Barbican. Although I have to admit after my stay this weekend I will be taking my custom else where .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ceedie
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel was excellent, right in the middle of Piccadilly. The lobby of the hotel was very nice and the staff were very accommodating. The room was small, cramped, outdated but comfortable and secure. The bed was actually comfortable and so were the pillows. I myself did not eat the breakfast since there is a McDonald's right next door, but my husband did once and he said you got the traditional English breakfast for $10. The A/C worked fine; I couldn't figure out how to use the heater though. I would stay here again because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “trying to think of something nice about the place..but cannot”
Reviews.Author: Les666
Reviews.Content: Reception staff ok, I got a feeling of overworked under paid.. Room reasonable size but VERY VERY out of date, window screwed shut and room was very HOT.. no setting for a/c so had to sweat all night.. bathroom with shower was disgusting, dirty, moldy, falling apart...bed had just a sheet over mattress and wasn't in great condition..haven't they heard of mattress protectors..yuck.. Horrible coffee, no fresh water, towels were clean, carpet worn, TV box style not a flat screen...all in all the WORST ROOM we have stayed in ...considering it cost Â£200 for the night I feel you can get a much better deal if you shop about... total dump and the owners should be ashamed to offer such rubbish especially when our company booked several rooms... no mini bar and bar shut before midnight....frankly there is nothing I can say that's nice about this place except the location is good, we will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy and tatty”
Reviews.Author: Warnstickle
Reviews.Content: My room was a disgrace. The wallpaper was coming off the wall and ripped, the carpet was stained, the cushion on the bed had a filthy mark on it, the bathroom ceiling was mouldy, the bottom of the toilet had dirty marks and all the plug holes were rusty. The breakfast was overcooked and inedible, apart from the toast that was freshly made. You couldn't get your fork in the bacon it was so hard and the sausage was rock hard. The scrambled eggs were grey.

Reviews.Title: “Central and Charming!!!!”
Reviews.Author: R K
Reviews.Content: The Thistle Piccadilly had the feel of old world charm with a touch of 'class'. The architecture of the building is beautiful. It is central to everything you ever wanted for London... close to tours, shopping, dining, m&m world, and maybe even a glimpse of a celebrity!!!! The service was very informative if needed any assistance on directions, etc..., very clean throughout the whole hotel including the rooms, rooms and bathrooms were a good size for Europe, and had a great view. I hope you enjoy it as much as we did!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - good value for money”
Reviews.Author: mcouldrey
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Thistle for 6 nights during the end of October in a deluxe room. We loved our stay there after travelling Europe. The room was big and the bed was comfy. I was a little cautious after reading some reviews, but our stay was great. Yeah the bathroom tiles may look outdated, but if that kind of stuff concerns you then perhaps you should book at The Ritz. Everything was at the hotel door step and would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Tatty Room and Bad Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: MarcusT007
Reviews.Content: I spent one night in this hotel on Oct 8th and found the hotel location to be excellent. The room was tired, but for the price I wasn't expecting The Ritz. Not long after checking in I discovered a puddle of water adjacent to the bed and soaked my socks standing in it! I reported it to reception, they promptly came to the room, but then told me they could do nothing until the morning and left..... no offer of another room change.....Unfortunately the position of the leak, meant I had no choice than to step in it to gain access to and from the bed, so NOT GOOD. I contacted The hotel via it's customer feedback on The Thistle Website with the above issues, but to date, have received no response..... although they seem to respond to Tripadvisor comments?!?!? I have stayed in numerous hotels in this group and found this hotel to be the worst out of my experience and the lack of a response to my complaint is very bad customer service. I would reccommend others to re-consider before staying here, partly due to poorly maintained rooms/bathrooms, but mainly due to bad customer service. I have attached a picture of the offending radiator which clearly shows it was not a recent one off leak.

Reviews.Title: “Suprising for a hotel smack bang in the middle of Leicester Square”
Reviews.Author: Chippyqueen
Reviews.Content: I was dubious about booking a room in a Thistle hotel on Lastminute ,,,there is always the curse of the 'Lastminute' room i.e. the grubbiest cupboard with no daylight!! but I have to say - I was pleasantly suprised. Thistle is not normally one of my favoured chains. The hotel is just on the corner of the Picadilly side of Leicester Square - upon arrive the lobby was clean, well decorated and well staffed. There was a mix up on the booking - I think it was Lastminute's fault for not sending the booking through the right channel but Whatever, It was late and I was hankering after TGI Friday's which is right next door. The room was a delux - facing onto the main road opposite the M&M's factory (that quintessential English tourist attraction!) but appart from a little noise - I had the comfiest nights sleep in a long time, the bed was beyond divine. The room was decorated in cream and navy with the obligatory mahogany furniture and the bathroom had shades of Local Authority Care Home chic but it was spotless and huge! I have booked to go back nearer Christmas as its pretty close to a number of Theatres i.e. Mama Mia is next door, Million Dollar Quartet is a few blocks away and Phantom on the Haymarket is next street along off Piccadilly. i walked to Marble Arch up Regent Street and along Oxford Road the next morning which took me 30 mins - I love food and dislike exercise so there is a benchmark for you people deciding if its too far away or too strenuous. Leicester Square looks like a dogs dinner at the moment - I think there is some work to improve the area ahead of the Olympics so dont be too disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “What a rip off”
Reviews.Author: Kate6161
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through lastminute and paid around Â£135 for the night which was about Â£100 too much. The room was tired with peeling wallpaper, the television did not work, the bedside lamp did not work. The bathroom was like something out of a 'how not to decorate a bathroom' worksheet. There was no sound insulation whatsoever so I was woken at regular intervals during the night by guests walking past to their room. The only good thing about this hotel is its location, but bearing in mind the area is awash with hotels at a similar price then I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure what to say!”
Reviews.Author: ollowood
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as we was having dinner with friends from overseas, so booked last minute. Paid Â£120 for the room but too be honest it was a rip off. The room was old and and the air conditioning was dripping allover the carpet! The bathroom was like someting out of the 60s and looked like it hadnt had a lick of paint for years! Check in staff we OK and i mean jjust OK. Great location although can be noisy of a night ! would stay again as a last minute in london but not for Â£120!

Reviews.Title: “Staff and location outshine the building”
Reviews.Author: Eddiepsych
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights on a combined business and social trip. The building has undoubtedly seen better days but the room was clean and the bed large all with a hint of "faded glory". However this was made up for by two things - friendly/helpful staff and a good location. The location is between Piccadilly and Leicester Squares with lots of places to eat, theaters etc and tube stations near by. Even the open-top bus tour stops right outside and a good supply of cabs pass the door. Downside to this is that it was noisy on the Friday night and we did not stays Saturday but imagine it was worse. One other criticism is that the buffet breakfast in the hotel at 10 pounds is too expensive for what you get especially with many alternatives nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: freddiekent
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 night theatre break at Thistle Hotel.Had read several reviews which described dated rooms in urgent need of refurbishment-sadly this is true but did not spoil an enjoyable stay due to perfect location and excellent customer services.Positives included speedy check in,helpful and polite staff and adequate room facilities including a very comfy bed with fabulously soft pillows! Negatives were the tired and shabby decor in both corridoors and rooms and dated pink bathroom suite with mouldy grout.Our room was at the back of the hotel and although the room was small and quite dark with a spectacular view of the fire escape-it was very clean,very quiet and we had a wonderful nights sleep.Insufficient toiletries for 2 adults on 2 night stay and not enough tea and milk on hospitality tray were only other minor grumbles.would definately stay here again but hope the decorators have been by then to take this hotel from a good rating to an excellent one.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: WelshWalker
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a one night stay at the Thistle Piccadilly. This was our third visit to this hotel. We've always been satisified with the service and the fantastic location which is why we return annually. However we must agree with other reviews with regards to the appearance of the rooms. Our room was clean, however it was in need of a refurb, the ceiling was cracked and there was black mould in the bathroom. The air con was inadequate and rather noisy! Breakfast was good - a wide selection of hot & cold food was available and the staff were exceptionally helpful and welcoming. The reception staff and concierge were also friendly and professional in appearance and attitude. We would stay here again because of the staff and location but we would hope the rooms are refurbished in the very near future. Although we rated this as 3 out of 5 we wanted to give it 3.5 because it does give good value for money as far as location & breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but bathroom was outdated and terrible”
Reviews.Author: Wouter-in-Tallinn
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night in this hotel yesterday. The location is excellent, the staff is kind and helpful. The room was fine however the bathroom was terrible. It needs to be rebuild urgently.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: CatherineSNewYork
Reviews.Content: I am a very picky traveler who usually stays at four and five star properties. London hotels are very expensive, though, so I decided to give this three star hotel a try. I was pleasantly surprised. This location of this hotel is perfect. The theaters, Chinatown, Trafalgar Square etc., are within walking distance. If you are traveling with kids, McDonald's is right across the street. I had a standard double room, and my daughter was upgraded to a deluxe king. My room was small with a view of the fire escape; my daughter's room was larger, with a view. When booking, I definitely would suggest the deluxe room. My family enjoyed the breakfast very much. There was a large selection to choose from. Everyone at the hotel was friendly and helpful. The hotel may be a little dated, but I had a nice experience here and I wouldn't hesitate staying here again on my next trip to London.

Reviews.Title: “Bad end to Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Bri123456
Reviews.Content: After 10 days in Venice in a real 4 star hotel for my wifeâ€™s 50th I booked a two day break in London on our return with a show to complete her holiday. What a disappoint this hotel was booked it though Lastminute.Com. The 1st room the air con heated the room we changed rooms and Lisa was very helpful with this may be a giveaway was the fact that the room had a fan in it to start with? The second room seam ok but when we got back to it and turned the air con off it was like being in a swimming pool with water running down the walls. It was now 12.30am we had been travelling from 7.00 am and where looking forward to a nice night sleep not possible in this hotel, again the staff where very help full to the point they knew of these problems in these rooms so why book any one in them read the other reviews on here same room numbers and floors also the room standards wall paper pealing carpets not fitting and black mould in every one of the bath rooms. The 3rd room we got was OK so the second night did not have to move rooms and thank god was not staying any longer than this. The hotel is past its sell by date and is at best 1 star. Well when we got I complete the Lastminute.Com customer satisfaction survey expressing my displeasure with this booking well that was as bad as the hotel standards no good some call centre that did not understand or care, so take the good customer service from the hotel and put these guys in to Lastminute.Com you may get one company that cares about customers service on all levels and do not tell you it will take 28 days to deal with your complaint which is the response from Lastminute.Com. Will look for other companies on line to book hotels with in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and very friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: YouInspireMe
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and found the staff to be very helpful and friendly, nothing was too much trouble. We had a problem with the shower on arrival and we were immediately moved to a better room and were treated exceptionally well. In particular thanks to Essam and Maxwell who were superb and clearly wanted us to have the best stay possible - thank you guys! We would not hesitate to return, abd recommend rooms on the higher floors where possible. The location cannot be beaten - literally bang next to Leicester Square! :) Enoy!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: Burtybasset
Reviews.Content: Is it on Piccadilly or is it on Leicester Square??? Itâ€™s positioned in an ideal location between the two. We only paid for a basic room as we knew we wouldnâ€™t be spending much time there. This was quite a small room, but had the basics we required. We were also aware from some previous reviews that the rooms were getting a bit tired - that is true, but if you look at what we paid in respect to the location (and we were aware of a recent refurbishment programme soon to start), itâ€™s not bad value. The staff were all good. The restaurant staff were very good (we only had breakfast there) and breakfast was very satisfactory. There were some faults though. The water pressure was very weak, and showering around â€˜peak timeâ€™ proved this! Our air con also decided not to work on the last night, we chose to live through it as we thought it was too late for the hotel to sort it out at that time of night and we did not want the hassle of maintenance visiting on the last night as we were settled. If the room rates are competitive after their refurb I would go back and stay again, purely because of the location of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely won't be returning”
Reviews.Author: Sarah T
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fantastic location but it is in serious need of cleaning and updating. This is the second time I've stayed and hoped that the second time would be better but both experiences have been the same. I booked a single room which was on the second floor (room 207) and expected some street noise but the old windows didn't shut properly and despite a glass screen the street noise was still very loud. The room was very dated with stained wallpaper peeling off at the edges and carpets that were stained (especially where damp from the windows) and there were exposed floor boards round the edge of the room. The bathroom was very dated with a shower with less power than the taps. Unfortunately during my visit the hotel was having problems with the plumbing and there was no hot water. When I asked why there was no hot water the hotel staff didn't appear to understand that this could be a problem for some people. Most disappointing in the bathroom was the really tiny sink, I've seen larger in caravans! The air con dial was broken and would only blow out cold air and the room was freezing as the air con was turned on full when I arrived. The hotel stairway smelled very strongly of damp and the dingy lighting made the hotel feel quite dirty. The TV signal in my room was quite poor and I could only get channels 1-3, not a disaster but again disappointing. I found the hotel staff friendly but uninterested. I paid Â£174 for a single room for one night but think (for the room I had and the hotel facilities) I would have liked to pay closer to Â£70 and is only for it's very central location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Gill616264
Reviews.Content: Had booked 4 double rooms and one single for a family break including my Mum who is in her 90's and on her very first trip to London. We arrived at 11.00 and the single room was ready, so we dropped our bags off there and headed off. We had been offered up-graded rooms at no extra cost and these were extremely clean and comfortable. All the staff were very friendly and helpful, especially the consierge guys who went out of their way to locate a pump to put more air in the tyres on Mums wheelchair. At the end of our trip were were allowed to leave our bags until the evening - all at no charge. We would certainly use this hotel again and have already recommended it to friends and colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the heart of Leicester Square!”
Reviews.Author: SuzieQNorthampton
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff, very helpful on check-in. Beautiful room which was surprisingly quiet, given the location right at the heart of Leicester Square. Good value too. I can't recommend this enough for a City or Theatre break!

Reviews.Title: “Another pleasent stay!”
Reviews.Author: Aljen
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a mini-break in London, and once again we stayed at the Thistle Piccadilly. We arrived early, so we left our luggage and went out for some lunch. When we returned, much to our surprise, we were given a free room upgrade. This was a very nice room on the seventh floor overlooking Leicester Square, but before we unpacked our bags we noticed that there was a lot of what sounded like mechanical sounds coming from above the room, and it wasn't from the air conditioning. So I mentioned this to Reception and they immediately moved us to another room which was much quieter and also larger - very satisfactory. What wasn't satisfactory was the decor which was looking a little shabby, especially in the bathroom, and the TV's sound quality was still rather muffled, it was all bass and no treble. But the breakfasts were, as usual, excellent. As for the staff, we couldn't find fault. They were all very quick to serve us and very helpful.Once again we can happily recommend this hotel. I have tried to be as honest as possible with this review and hope that it will be helpful to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel set right next to Leicester Square. Convenient. Very late start to breakfast on weekends.”
Reviews.Author: GGlen78
Reviews.Content: This hotel is set right in the heart of the West End. You couldn't get more central than this. The staff were very helpful in getting a fridge put in my room, as I had bought some food to bring back home. I had to check-out at 7.30 am on a Saturday morning, and apparently this was too early to get breakfast. This is simply not on. The room price was 260 GBP per night, which is too steep in my opinion

Reviews.Title: “Dingy. Shabby. Nothing to Recommend”
Reviews.Author: DrSpyke
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while in London for a conference; the hotel was booked by the conference organizer, so I doubt this would have been my choice. Having stayed there, I can definitely say it will never be my choice again. The hotel is centrally located, right on Leicester Square, so its location is good if you want to be able to get pretty much anywhere in London easily. Not so good if you don't like the crowds and hectic atmosphere of Leicester Sq. Whether that's a net plus or net minus is up to you. The big drawback is the hotel itself. The room I was in was small and cramped (not unusual for London) and shabby, with old and worn furniture, drapes, and linens. The room had the most unbelievably filthy windows looking out into a dusty air shaft... such a lovely view to greet the guest every morning! Breakfasts were plentiful but mediocre at best. A telling moment came on my first morning, when a woman at the next table complained that the waiter had brought her tea instead of coffee... it turned out that it was coffee, but so weak that the mistake was understandable. There are plenty of other hotels that provide much better value... try one of those instead of this one.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: DaveW62
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff need training in hospitality and being 'children friendly'. Rooms are small and poorly maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Some improvements needed”
Reviews.Author: Loumund
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights. It was a brilliant price and a fantastic location. Very close to tube station and walking distance to many sites. However, when we arrived, the reception staff had no details of our stay, nor the couple next to us who were staying 6 nights and were from America. Their excuse was that 'there werent many staff on the day before'. They didnt even apologise! They took my husbands credit card for any charges to the room. We went to get a drink in the bar that night and they said they couldnt charge it to the room and had no record of his card details. This also happened at breakfast when we got charged Â£20 (instead of it going on to the room). Our room was basic. Nice bed and tv. Bathroom was basic too. Shower didnt drain very well. The room and the corridors just need a lick of paint and updating. It needs some improvements. I am just pleased that we paid a cheap rate. It certainly wasnt worth anymore! We generally rate the hotels that we stay in with 4 or 5 out of 5 but we both agreed that we would give this a 3. Our first 3 on trip advisor!!! No one at reception asked if we had had a nice stay. Surely this would just be polite?

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot quite a small room”
Reviews.Author: Dirne72
Reviews.Content: Hotel couldnâ€™t be better located great for whatever you are after in London, bit pricey for such a basic room but it was clean and tidy if a little small, my room seemed to have been squeezed into a space between other rooms but all in all nothing to cause me to complain.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not as good as my first visit”
Reviews.Author: angleseymember
Reviews.Content: As the title suggests, I have stayed here before which was one of the main reasons I chose to stay again. To be fair though, on my first visit, I did get a room upgrade which I didn't this time round! Got allocated a room straight away even though we were early. As many people have commented on already, rooms are in need of an update, but we were happy enough as room was clean, bathroom also, so no complaints. Breakfast on both mornings were of a good standard, with more than enough choice to suit all tastes. My only slight gripe is that I had to attract attention to have my coffee cup refilled, wouldn't it be better for all concerned to have a pot as for the tea drinkers (?). We were going to the theatre on both evenings, (Priscilla Queen of the Desert and Jersey Boys) and both are within minutes walk of the hotel. That was a great bonus! Original Bus Tour is also opposite hotel, so very convenient location for that purpose also. I booked our stay via Superbreak with ticket for theatre included in price, and believed I got a very good deal. I paid approx Â£150.00 for two nights with full breakfast and top price ticket for Jersey Boys which I would thoroughly recommend! Despite my title, I would still stay here again as the location is fantastic, only first time round my opinion was based on the room upgrade!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, rooms need renovating”
Reviews.Author: KCFanSheffield
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights at the end of March 11. The hotel is very well positioned straight in between Piccadilly Circus and Leicester Square. All staff we came into contact with were very polite and helpful. We had a fairly small room (I have stayed in smaller) which was in despirate need of updating and redecoration. There was very obvious damage to the corridor wall in the room. The room was very well cleaned. Spare pillows were to be found in the wardrobe if needed. Very big luxerious towels which makes a change in a hotel. Although we had a room on the busy side street (all the tour buses go along this street) there was very little noise transfer and no noise transfer from adjoining rooms. We had a room on the fourth floor and to get from the lift to our room there were two steps - OK for us but I hope they don't expect wheelchair users to do the same. Breakfast was good with a large choice, some freshly made to order. Upon request we were allowed us an extra hour to check out, though when we arrived back after the original check out time our room key would not work, which meant a trip back to reception where our keys were promptly reactivated. Would reccommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be in central London. If you want internet access there were signs saying that time had to be purchased -i would save your money and go to McDonalds across the road where they have free WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Very central hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellertopoland2
Reviews.Content: This middle-range hotel is well located between Piccadilly Circus and Leicester Square, and is ideal for the tourist-entertainment areas in London. My friend and I used the hotel as a base booking through www.between9and5.com. We had room 507 looking out onto the street but the double glazing was very effective. The room was triangular shape with a standard size bed. The bath room had a bath with integral shower. Oddly it was equipped with towel and kit for one person, though we had booked a double. The room was small but we paid only Â£95 for the day, so the price was fair for the location. We had no meals in the hotel. We lunched at the Criterion a short walk away towards Piccadilly Circus

Reviews.Title: “Excellent night sleep in Central London!”
Reviews.Author: SLR&SLR
Reviews.Content: Hi - My husband and I stayed for one night at the Thistle Piccadilly. The location is excellent! The room was a bit dark as it was at the back of the hotel, but having stayed in Central London before, I didn't complain as I knew it would allow me to sleep better than if I was at the front of the hotel...And OMG, I slept so well! We didn't hear anything at all (outside or in the corridor), which was fantastic. The bed, which was a bit small, was however very comfortable, and the pillows were just perfect! I wish I could have taken the pillows home with me! Breakfast was also very good - we had to wait a little while as it was busy, but it was worth the wait. (However, the waitress forgot our toasts...Never mind!) We also had a few drinks at the bar in the evening and the staff were excellent. They had remembered what we were drinking from our visit there in the afternoon! I would definitely recommend this hotel and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Dreigiau
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with our stay in the Thistle Piccadilly. The rooms are a bit small but clean. The hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful. The location is brilliant and the breakfast was very good. The bar was area was small (off reception area), plenty of nearby alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on for service & location.”
Reviews.Author: Aljen
Reviews.Content: Our stay was a birthday treat for me - my 65th. The reception team put a wonderful cake & birthday card (from themselves) in our room! We had a Deluxe King room which was spacious & beautifully furnished. The breakfast room was very peaceful with excellent service and a good selection of food. As for the hotel's location, it was ideal - right in the centre for theatres, restaurants, shops & public transport. The only faults we could find were that the bed was a little too firm, & we couldn't adjust the TV's sound quality which was rather muffled. My wife & I highly recommend this hotel. We have stayed at other Thistle Hotels which have also been excellent. This was not the first time that we have stayed there, and it most certainly won't be the last! A & J, Bexhill-on-Sea.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: coefamily5
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous room, suite in fact, right at the top. The staff there were the most friendly I have met. The receptionists recommended where to eat and when the concierge heard where we were going he came over with a map with the directions marked out for us. Even at breakfast the staff couldnt do enough for us.

Reviews.Title: “Do not go to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Harmony27
Reviews.Content: I have stayed for one night in this Hotel and I would definitely not recomend it! The morning of my departure and while showering I heard weird noise. I was looking at the shower and the weird noise carried on so I moved a bit away. All of a sudden, the shower head pop out and hit my foot. Fortunately it missed my face! I was so annoyed that this could had made a serious injure and this proves that they have no real consideration of health and safety. Due to this, I complained at reception (very friendly staff), and left my business card and I was told that someone from the Management Department was going to contact me. Which has been almost a week and I am still waiting. As I work in a 5* Hotel, I find it insane for such a situation to take place and still get no feedback from this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in an amazing location”
Reviews.Author: acurrow
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Thistle for one night and found it lovely. We arrived at the hotel around 11am and asked the staff if it was ok to leave our bags and they kindley checked us in early so we were able to go to our room and leave our bags. Checking in was very quick and staff were very friendly. Room was just what we needed. Very clean. Bathrooms can do with a make-over but fine considering we hardley spent anytime in our room. Bar staff were lovely and area was always kept clean. Checking out was quick and simple too and we were able to leave our bags in the hotel all day and collect them just before out train. Location is great couldnt ask for anything better. Right inbetween Leicester Square tube and Piccadilly station. Found the hotel as soon as we came out of the tube station. So many shops and places to have food and drinks. Would definatly stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location needing a good upgrade to rooms”
Reviews.Author: V_Damo
Reviews.Content: If you're wanting to experience the hustle and bustle on London life this hotel is the place to stay, with loads of theatres, restaurants, shopping and night life in the surrounding areas. Convenient enough to walk up Regent and Oxford Sts, Trafalgar Square, Buckingham Palace and the boutique areas of Covent Garden and Marylebone. We were looking forward to a spacious room having flown in from Tokyo after a 12 hour flight. We were greeted with a small Victorian decorated room and a small double bed. The bathrooms have a small slim bath tub which you shower in and the shower curtain is constantly in the way of a satisfying shower. We upgraded our room the next day and whilst the bed was bigger the shower situation was the same as was the dated decor. In addition, the air conditioning system was noisy and needed attention whilst we were there. The hotel staff do not greet guests and asking a question at the front desk seems to displace the staff. On one particular day I asked for a printout and the front desk clerk replied "No chance", without an apology or sensible explanation.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay,very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: hazelnutfriut
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel during a short break booked through tomas cook.the room was very good and was cleaned every day.the staff work very hard and are very helpful.the breakfast was excellent,with plenty to choose from.we never experience any noise as our room was located at the back.the only thing was, the bed was uncomfortable,too hard for us.difficult to get some sleep.if you are a smoker this hotel has no smoking rooms what so ever.just have to smoke outside the entrance.

Reviews.Title: “We were very satisified with everything about this hotel, bathroom probably needs updating but was very clean.”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraS067
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews I was a bit doubtful about what to expect but all I can give is our experience of the hotel. It is in a great location, a bit noisy at night but after a full day in London who has problems sleeping? All the staff were friendly and helpful - a member of the cleaning staff even gave us directions to our room unasked when we emerged from the lift. The room was large and well furnished. The standard lamp was not working but we reported it that evening and when we arrived back at the hotel the following day it had been fixed. The bathroom could probably do with updating but having said that it was very clean with a good supply of hot water and nice towels. We only took breakfast in the hotel but the service was excellent and the range of food plentiful and good. This is not a modern"chrome and glass" hotel but I would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Bit grubby, room was tiny and very, very noisy.”
Reviews.Author: dodds77
Reviews.Content: First time I've ever asked for a free upgrade and seemingly got one.....although I'm not sure as the room we got was really poor, it was tiny and pretty dirty, the bathroom wasn't upto scratch either. Perhaps its a joke staff play on guests who cheekily ask if theres any free upgrades! Checkout took forever also as staff kept coming and going and nobody really bothered taking us on. The noise at night is unbearable and thats even being on one of the highest floors. Breakfast was grim unfortunately and in a tiny little room. The location really is ideal though, right in the middle of it all.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location - average hotel”
Reviews.Author: lego364
Reviews.Content: Great location round the corner from the West End (ideal hotel for seeing a show) and Leicester Square. Large hotel with small rooms. Breakfast was chaotic as there were more guests than seats available. Overall ideal for short stay to be central for sightseeing/visit to theatre.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel you rent by the hour, not by the day. Picture is not of the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: msmuffet208
Reviews.Content: Horrible at best. One client stood by the front door and played with himself as I tried to find another hotel on the cumputer. Staff made fun of the clients' complaints. Not worth being close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: CaramelKoala
Reviews.Content: We were worried initially because we had read about how small hotel rooms are in London. We booked a triple for the three of us and it was bigger than my lounge and kitchen together! We got off the Underground station and a very nice gentleman took pity on the poor lost women with no idea where East was, and guided us to the hotel, where he worked! The staff were very friendly, and we stored our luggage whilst sightseeing, as we got in from Heathrow at the inhumane hour of 6:30am. Our room was large, clean and had a nice view of the area. The bathroom was bigger than mine, and all white. The bed was large enough for two grown women to sleep in with a line of pillows down the middle and STILL not touch anything. I slept on the sofa bed and was very comfortable. Breakfast was included in the very reasonable price, and was delicious. Hot and cold breakfast, range of juices and pastries and fresh fruit. It was central to everything we wanted to do and see. We are planning on staying here again next year, just due to how nice this was.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff but bathrooms need updating”
Reviews.Author: Cotswoldian1
Reviews.Content: We arrived early evening having not planned to stay over. We were greeted by charming reception staff and given a small discount on the room rate, which was nice. We were also upgraded to a larger room which was also a nice touch. The reception, bar and room were all OK but really could do with a bit of an upgrade. The bathroom seriously needed updating - pink soap dishes and tiles ? 1983? The plus points are the fantastically central location and the marvellously helpful and pleasant staff. For just shy of Â£200 per night for room only the need for upgrading is brought more into focus. However, the hotel is spotlessly clean and we would definitely stay again. London hotel pricing and stars are incredibly varied and you could do a lot worse than this.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good beds - Excellent location and fair price”
Reviews.Author: WeekendBreakAddict
Reviews.Content: Stayed 30th July to 1st August. I have stayed here a few years ago and nothing really has changed. Staff are good, friendly and very helpfull. Room wansnt anything flash but was very clean and the bed was very nice. Upon arrival, we were given a discount voucher for Â£5.00 off breakfast, which we had on sunday morning. Good breakfast for Â£10.00 each and plenty of it. This hotel is in a great location and being on holiday means that my hotel room is pretty much a place to sleep, I find this hotel good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Needs renovating”
Reviews.Author: WorkTwoTravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located but it is also in the middle of the late night action with a lot of noise until early morning hours. There were double windows which helped restrict the noise level. The hotel needs serious renovating. Its dirty, worn carpets, pink tiled bathrooms and scarred interior walls are un-inviting. London was hot when we visited but fortunately the rooms were air conditioned.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, polite and efficient staff”
Reviews.Author: Debsgsd
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for central London and proved very good value for the price that I paid. The rooms could do with being updated but it is just cosmetic - the beds and bathroom were spotless. If you are looking for an overnight stay close to theatres, night life and all the attractions, I would thoroughly recommend this traditional hotel. (I would also recommend spending the money on the breakfast - lovely restaurant and great, fresh selection to set you up for the day!)

Reviews.Title: “never go there !”
Reviews.Author: Stratula
Reviews.Content: So, nice location but .......teh hotel is old and noisy, one of the two lifts did not work, breakfast was very poor for the price I payed and they sell expensive internet but they don't have even Microsoft Office on the computer so I needed to go daily at a internet cafe to see my documents. I will never come back !

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: KathyIreland30
Reviews.Content: We booked Thistle Piccadily for 2 nights in April 2010 and we were delighted with the location and convenience to the West End. We had booked to see Les Miserables and as luck would have it, the theatre was located about 5 mins walk from the hotel. It is small but very charming. We could walk everywhere from here and it felt very safe. We are hoping to return to London in December and will definitely book here.

Reviews.Title: “Stealing at the end”
Reviews.Author: Den111
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel is perfect. And first impressions were positive though it was too noisy and rooms need to be repaired. But at the end happened smth that changed my opinion to opposite. I forgot several things in wardrobe. After check out I returned to take them but the staff said that they found only one thing that wasn't so expensive in comparison with other things. So, smb stole my clothes. I dont know who but I hope the police and maybe thistle team will find out who. Besides there were not any apologies from the staff. So, be careful.

Reviews.Title: “incompetence rules!”
Reviews.Author: metropolitan10
Reviews.Content: The hotel got important details of my booking wrong from the moment i checked in, and continued to do so for the duration of my 7-night stay. My frustration was compounded by the fact that the check-in desk NEVER responded to formal complaints, nor was I ever offered an apology by either lobby or restaurant staff when they mistakenly had me on their "breakfast not included in rate" list. Furthermore, the hotel uses the BTopenzone Wi Fi system of room internet access. No regular traveller will need me to tell them this is one of the most costly, least efficient packages available. But the hotel doesn't care - why should it - it's not accountable to anybody. So here's what passes for accountability from a disgruntled customer: I will NEVER use your hotel again and I urge others to avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Makeover required!”
Reviews.Author: StarryDes
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Thistle for 6 days. Nice, cosy english hotel but its really old. We can hear next door's slamming their doors every morning at 9am - corporate clients off to business meetings i guess. Luckily we were up by then too. Concierge is very helpful and receiptionist wise also very kind and friendly. We were staying on the 2nd floor and were just opposite the 'noisy' mini casino / streets with mad people screaming / laughing / talking till wee hours. But we were so tired that we dozed off immediately but you can still hear the faint scream / laughter. Good location, easy access to tubes etc, downside is that the hotel is very old. Floors give away 'cracky' sound when you walked and weird smell when you walked past thru the concierge and a small door to reach the lift. Maybe they should freshen the area. Will stay in this hotel again, recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Needs a makeover”
Reviews.Author: juviam
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were very friendly, and the reception gives the wrong impression, as the rooms are not quite so plush. We stayed in a standard room at the back of the hotel, and the whole room needed a makeover. The paper was peeling off the wall, mould in the bathroom and very old, scratched furniture. The kings size bed took over the whole room, leaving not much room to walk round it. A little disappointing, and not worth the money. I would suggest another hotel, even if it only for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Give Room 508 a MISS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hoptonblue
Reviews.Content: Great Location but at Â£200 Per night the room was disgusting. I arrived with my teenage daughter and for 6 hours it looked like we could be sharing a double bed ( me being her dad and not her mother ). There was nearly enough towels and complimentary showering products for 1 person. The room itself was old and dirty looking and for 2 hours my daughter refused to fall asleep ( it was only her tiredness that got the better of her in the end)She was also on her phone searching the internet for other places to stay nearby thats how she took to the room we had been given!!!!!We booked a delux twin so I would hate to see the state of a standard room. When the maid finally came to alter the bed arrangements she would not comment on the state of the room , she was just plain ignorant and kept referring to speaking with reception. We did learn that there were better rooms in the hotel but were maybe penalised because we did not look like business people or because I had my daughter with me. Thinking about it we never saw another child in the hotel for the duration of our stay!!! I have been fortunate enough to travel a lot through work and leisure and I can honestly say that this is the worst room that I have ever had the displeasure of staying in. :-(

Reviews.Title: “A disappointing hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: bazzerHampshire
Reviews.Content: A great location for the West End but spoilt with a drab and depressing room, wallpaper peeling off walls, a bathrooom that suited the 1950's, no tea making facilities, noisy bathroom extractor fan on all night, no bed valance showing an extremely grubby mattress bed base. Very noisy front of hotel room with buskers playing outside till midnight and revellers until 4am and this was a weekday night..not what we expected or what was displayed on the hotel website.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: FrisHB
Reviews.Content: We stayed over here on a trip to Denmark. The rooms were an adequate size and were clean. The staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfasts were fine, but the same every day. It was the location that won us over. Right in the heart of Picadilly and next to the West End with plenty of restaurants and shops. The on/off bus stop was right out front.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location At A Good Price”
Reviews.Author: billybunter38
Reviews.Content: Enoyed a 2 night stay here a bit noisy from outside but good value and an excellent location for the West End.Nice breakfasts

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good price.”
Reviews.Author: hellojudi
Reviews.Content: And that's pretty much what you get here. Rooms are dated and worn but clean. It was a good value for the location; the rooms need some updating, and I guess that would be the trade off. The staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location - book it!”
Reviews.Author: 3MadPups
Reviews.Content: This hotel is based in the heart of west end where shops, restaurants, theatres, bars are a plenty! Arriving on Friday afternoon we took the tube and got off at Piccadilly underground - the hotel is literally 5 mins from this stop. Staff were so pleasant and helpful on arrival and the room was fine - we booked one up from the standard room which gave us a tv. Definately recommend this hotel and can't wait to go back to London! PS rec ommend the Comedy Store which is around the corner - great night's craic!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent value - but very very tired”
Reviews.Author: Hamish11
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, just off Leicester Square and a 5 minute walk to Covent Garden, SoHo, Regent Street. We paid just over Â£100 for a double room, which is amazing value for a central London hotel, especially in this location and mid-week. The price really reflects the quality I'm afraid! My room was spacious with a huge bed, but had no other features to recommend. The carpets were dirty, worn & not fitted all the way to the walls, the furnishings were very old and not co-ordinated, the walls were in a terrible condition and in desperate need of re-papering, and the bathroom was the most disgusting 1970s pink with a shower that totally flooded the floor. My room was really cold when I arrived, but then I found that all the radiators were turned off. Perhaps my expectations were too high, but I associated Thistle name with reliability and good standards. Sadly, the Thistle Piccadilly is no more than a low-end budget lodging but in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “great location, shame about the very noisey room and not just from outside”
Reviews.Author: winniethepoohLondon
Reviews.Content: have just spent a night here, we expected noise from outside as we have spent many nights in london so know what it can be like, but the noise was in the room and continuous all night. a tapping and what sounded like an extractor going through the room (it wasnt the air con) it was like chinese torture. a bit mean on the milk for tea only enough for 1 cup each good job we were out all the time, the shampoos etc were half full so it looks like they refill and had forgot the ones in our room, we were on the 7th floor overlooking the sq great views and great location for wherever you needed to go. seemed pricey and have stayed in nicer places for less money.

Reviews.Title: “If you enjoy sleeping on a park bench then this is for you..”
Reviews.Author: enjoysabreak
Reviews.Content: Stayed from Thursday to Sunday. The standard double room is clean but the bed is the most uncomfortable I've ever slept on, you need to change position regularly to avoid paralysis (and I imagine like sleeping on a park bench!). Having spent a lot of time visiting many hotels on city breaks this is not on my list of 'would return anytime soon'.The hotel relies upon it's location rather than it's amenities and comfort. The staff are friendly and keen to please but this does not make up for the lack of facilities. On the plus side, they do provide a good breakfast and the bar offers a decent last stop before retiring but the rooms are in desperate need of an update (the last time I had a hairdryer like that i was trying to emulate a Farrah Fawcett flick!). The worst, however, is the noise on a Saturday night. Friday was bearable but on Saturday I thought the hotel fire alarm had gone off at half three in the morning but realised it was a police siren from outside.Decent double glazing and decor upgrading would make this a hotel worthy of a good weekend break.Â

Reviews.Title: “suited our needs”
Reviews.Author: andienewzealand
